text: This article lists various statistics related to Selangor Football Club. All statistics accurate as of 26 July 2019 unless stated otherwise. == Honours == === Domestic === ==== League ==== *Malaysia League / Semi-Pro Division 1 League / Premier League / Premier League 1 / Super League ** Winners (6): 1984, 1989, 1990, 2000, 2009, 2010 *** Runner-up (5): 1995, 2002, 2013, 2014, 2015 *Semi-Pro Division 2 League / Premier League 2 / Premier League ** Winners (2): 1993, 2005 *** Runner-up (1): 1999 ==== Cups ==== *Malaysia Cup ** Winners (33): 1922, 1927, 1928, 1929, 1935, 1936, 1938, 1949, 1956, 1959, 1961, 1962, 1963, 1966, 1968, 1969, 1971, 1972, 1973, 1975, 1976, 1978, 1979, 1981, 1982, 1984, 1986, 1995, 1996, 1997, 2002, 2005, 2015 *** Runner-up (16): 1921, 1924, 1925, 1930, 1932, 1933, 1937, 1939, 1948, 1957, 1965, 1980, 1983, 1991, 2008, 2016 *FA Cup ** Winners (5): 1991, 1997, 2001, 2005, 2009 *** Runner-up (3): 1990, 2008, 2018 *Charity Cup ** Winners (8): 1985, 1987, 1990, 1996, 1997, 2002, 2009, 2010 *** Runner-up (6): 1991, 1998, 2003, 2006, 2011, 2016 *FAM Cup (1951-1989: as a secondary knockout competition between teams only after Piala Malaysia) ** Winners (7): 1953(shared), 1960, 1961, 1962, 1966, 1968, 1972 *** Runner-up (6): 1952, 1955, 1964, 1967, 1969, 1970 === Continental === ====Cup ==== *Asian Club Championship / AFC Champions League ** Winners (0): *** Runner-up (1): 1967 == Players == All current players are in bold === Appearances === ==== Records appearances ==== * Youngest first- team player: * Oldest first-team player: * Most consecutive League appearances: * Shortest appearance: ==== Al-time appearances ==== Competitive, professional matches only. |align=center| 16 |- |align=center| 2018 | Rufino Segovia |align=center| 19 |- |} === Transfers === == Managerial == === Managerial records === * First manager cum head coach: K. Devan – Devan was the 1st coaching manager (also as Head Coach) of FA Selangor that was appointed. He serve the clubs from 2009 to 2011. * Longest-serving manager: * Most competition win manager: Abdul Ghani Minhat - Won 1 Malaysia League (1984) title, 4 Malaysia Cup (1971) (1972) (1973) (1984), 1 FAM Cup (1972), and 1 Charity Shield (1985) * Most Super League titles win manager: K. Devan - Won 2 in 2009, 2010 season. === Managerial statistics === Information correct as of 18 December 2019.
